data.title: Add sprintf
data.body:
This isn't ready to pull yet, but I wanted to show you what I had so far to ensure that I'm not going about it the wrong way, as you told me on my last attempt.

Currently supports very simple printf formats:

```
"%s" % any_variant
"%d %f %o %x %x" % [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
```

I also need to ask where I should put the docs for this in the repo.

Suggested in #1131

data.title: add a light to the 3D shader material demo
data.body: added a light to the scene to prevent people thinking Godot is broken

data.title: proper plain-text resource format needed
data.body:
We need a good plain-text resource format that is more readable, more friendly to version control systems, and doesn't change with every press of Ctrl+S even if nothing has been actually edited. 

Open Data Description Language (http://www.openddl.org) syntax would be ideal for this (not using their library, if licensing is an issue, just copy the format). It looks very simple and human-readable. 

Everything needs to be sorted in a reproducible manner so that files only change when something has actually been changed.

The need for a new format had been mentioned by Juan in the past, but I didn't find an open issue about it in my quick search, so I opened this one.

NOTE: I tried my hand at fixing the order that the current XML resource saver is writing out files. While I was able to get the changes to be less dramatic between saves, it still changed every time due to a few properties still not ordering correctly, and the external resources being a set means they can't easily be sorted like a list can (supposed to just sort itself, but that's not exactly happening in a predictable way). Maybe someone better at C++ than me can fix it in the meantime, but a better format would still be ideal in the long run, and much appreciated.

data.title: fix saving texture flags to *.png.flags file, closes #399
Filtering occurs when downscaling sprites though filtering is disabled
data.body:
As discovered by Zyllan in the forums here: http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1331

Filtering still occurs when downscaling sprites though filtering is disabled.
In the demo project all sprites are instances from the same base sprite using the same texture, with filtering and mip maps turned off in flags and in project settings.
At 1X scale the static one looks fine but the rotating one filtering flickers on and off.
At less than 1X both are always filtered.
At greater than 1X both are never filtered as expected.
It looks like magnification filter is turned off but minification filter isn't.
Demo project: https://docs.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0B7Mva4UEh5kxWW9wcnB4Nm1zQlk
![](http://img.uninhabitant.com/filtering_bug.png)

data.title: Clearing TileMap "Tile Set" property also clears cells
data.body: Clearing "Tile Set" property in a TileMap and all of the TileMap's cell will be cleared too, so if you load a TileSet again the TileMap is now empty and all your map work is lost.

data.title: add_collision_exception_with
data.body: `add_collision_exception_with` doesn't seem to work with KinematicBody2D. Does exactly nothing.

data.title: should check GPU capabilities and exit gracefully
data.body:
I think Godot should somehow check if the system can handle GLES2 or not, and instead of aborting or failing, present a meaningful error message to the user about their drivers not supporting GLES2. "Your computer does not appear to currently support GLES2, which is required to run this program. New drivers or hardware upgrade is required." Something along those lines.

I am not sure what this would take to do, but there must be some way to do it in the code.

This is specifically for Windows users who seem to always have crappy GPUs and crappy drivers, but ideally the checks would be on all platforms.

data.title: duplicating node with only numbers in name got extra space in name

data.title: Path2D curve handle editing doesn't take zoom level into consideration
data.body:
Not sure if it's just me doing something wrong or if it's a genuine bug, although I managed to replicate it easily on both Windows and Ubuntu on two different machines.

There seems to be an issue with editing curve handles in that it doesn't take into account the current zoom level of the scene. If you zoom right in and try and drag a curve handle, the distance it moves is a lot greater than the distance you move you mouse. This means a lot of the time the curve handle will quickly fly off and disappear from the view and you have to scroll to find it again.

Great work with Godot so far, though! I'm really looking forward to making stuff with it!

data.title: Mixing back slashes with forward slashes, in the same path.
data.body:
Sometimes, you're mixing back and foward slahes in the same path.
`File "./platform/windows\detect.py", line 109:` (See in context below.)
To reproduce : The error was caused because I didn't issue the command after first calling `vcvarsall.bat`.

``` Text
Microsoft Windows [Version 6.3.9600]
(c) 2013 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

C:\Users\Robert>cd C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot

C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot>C:\Python27\Scripts\scons platform=windows
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
TypeError: cannot concatenate 'str' and 'NoneType' objects:
  File "C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot\SConstruct", line 190:
    detect.configure(env)
  File "./platform/windows\detect.py", line 109:
    env.Append(CCFLAGS=['/I'+os.getenv("WindowsSdkDir")+"/Include"])

C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot>
```

data.title: The name of the target is fixed to godot.windows.tools.exe?
data.body:
In the [compile instructions for Windows](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/compiling_windows), under the heading `Compiling` :

> If all goes well, the resulting binary executable will be placed in `C:\godot\bin\godot_win.exe`

It's actually `godot.windows.tools.exe`.

On the same page, under the heading `Development in Visual Studio or other IDEs` :

> To build the whole engine from a single command outside the command prompt, the following should be called in a .bat file:
> `C:\path_to_sdk\vcvarsall.bat &&  scons bin/godot_win.exe`

Specifying `godot_win.exe`, or any name other than `godot.windows.tools.exe`, results in this error.
A successful compilation is only achieved by specifying `bin/godot.windows.tools.exe` or omitting the target. :

``` Text
C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot> "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat" amd64 && "C:\Python27\Scripts\scons.bat" platform=windows bin\godot.win.exe
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
scons: *** Do not know how to make File target `bin\godot.win.exe' (C:\home\robert\game-engines\godot\bin\godot.win.exe).  Stop.
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: Fix compile error when tools=no
F12 to screenshot
data.body: I think it'd be good for Godot to have a built-in ability to screenshot the running project. It could be saved into a single filename under res:// so pressing F12 multiple times would overwrite one image. And this same image could be used in a revamped Project Manager window, like ndee's mockup with the Brave Bran picture.

data.title: Image Preview from "Resources" or "FileSystem"
data.body:
I would like to submit a request to preview images when clicking on the name from the Resources Tab or the FileSystem Tab down below.

Currently, when you double-click on a PNG image under FileSystem, it opens highlights the name of the file under Resources. Maybe when you double-click on the file name under Resources it could force the Inspector Tab to show a small preview of what the image looks like. The current implementation changes the Inspector Window, but does not select the tab and make it visible. A PNG image is described by it's dimensions, compression, mipmaps, quality, etc.

data.body:
TEST FILE: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/31390469/bug%20bin/scalar_op_bug.zip

Instructions: go to objects shader graph and change present there Scalar Const to 0.5.

From what I tested occurs only with this test file, I tried to make simpler example and it didn't crashed there.

data.title: VSE Bug - Scalar Uniform of Vertex Shader resets Name if you hit Enter while editing it
data.body:
Uniforms in Visual Shader Editor don't allow to use spacebar in their param name. They reset to default if spacebar is used.

CamelCase is also reset to Camelcase, now I'm not sure if it is a bug or a feature :D

data.title: OS X: Add keyboard layout detection and fix build
False positive on error trying to connect to peer (Condition ' p_peer.is_null() ' is true)
Undo performs both on popup and script editor
data.body:
I was editing a script, then I opened the ProjectProperties window to set up some key mappings. But I made mistakes, and wondered if I could undo.
It actually worked, but every time I pressed CTRL+Z, the script editor behind was undoing too, at the same time. It seems like the event is not well focused on the ProjectProperties window.
PS: difficult to find a meaningful short title, I hope it's clear enough :)

data.title: VSE request - bigger or "unlimited" span of working area
data.body:
This one will be a bit hard to explain, but is important.

We pan view in VS Editor with middle mouse, but user is limited to area of visible nodes, he can't move more than that.

It creates problem when user wants to move to clean area to add some new nodes.

Currently to workaround this problem I would create some node and moved it little by little to right beyond Editor Canvas until I will create big enough working area to fiddle with nodes. Problem is that it would be needles hassle.

Good example is Blender Node Editor. User can freely move his view to emptier part of canvas where he can work on new nodes.

I hope I explained it well, if not I can make some illustrations to visualize problem.

data.title: VSE request - multi selection and translation of nodes
data.body:
As in title, crucial for managing bigger trees of nodes.

UPDATE
Bounding Box Selection would be great too.
